data.text:
60% of the 821 million people who are food insecure in the world are women & girls. 

@WFP is working to provide assistance to those who need it most. https://t.co/kh0tGC9iV5 #WomenAreHungrier https://t.co/9MEhqqKg6y

Women in Tanzania are gaining economic empowerment by helping to drive the country's burgeoning tea industry. 

More on how @UN_Women is supporting them, including in their fight against sexual harassment & other forms of gender-based violence: https://t.co/KdYU8hShpZ https://t.co/IsmTfDi1hV

"There is no justifiable reason for 265 million children to be out of school at this very moment."

-- @UN_PGA calls for greater investment in education at annual @IPUparliament hearing. #GlobalGoals https://t.co/Auz9tX8GWm

Monday's Donors' Conference in Brussels appealed for funds to support reconstruction efforts in Albania, after a powerful earthquake hit the country in November.

@UNDP & partners are helping people rebuild their lives. https://t.co/5fyZWQnRir

What has the UN ever done for YOU? 

From eradicating smallpox to healing the ozone layer to setting global standards on medicine & more - for 75 years, the UN has touched the lives of everyone, everywhere. #UN75 https://t.co/8A7Ama99UZ 

https://t.co/wKuPRtkVYU

A choir of refugee children from Afghanistan & kids from Pakistan performed for @antonioguterres during the #RefugeeSummit in Islamabad, where he called for more youth empowerment and solidarity #WithRefugees. https://t.co/7uxIsVOLPc https://t.co/aFgRhdZpPG

How can countries design and realize innovative strategies to prevent and end homelessness?

Top global experts continue looking for answers at the #CSocD58 at UNHQ this week. https://t.co/C6rIK9YGi9 #GlobalGoals https://t.co/bkDV2MK1as
Happening this week: #SocialJusticeDay, #MotherLanguageDay & much more. Full list here: https://t.co/aOqF6cv967 https://t.co/LUmmA9z7Pq

“One of the main purposes of my visit is to spotlight the real Pakistan — with all its possibility and potential."

-- @antonioguterres discussed #ClimateAction & #GlobalGoals, and met with refugees in Islamabad. https://t.co/xggCfgrcOD https://t.co/6VeDGzTTF5

Meet Ekram Abakar Juma - the first woman deminer from Sudan! 
Ekram is working to protect her own people from the threat of explosives. She also hopes to inspire more women to become deminers. 

More on @UNMAS' work in Sudan: https://t.co/JGVWbmmllj https://t.co/0zuD4m25jt

I have enormous admiration for the resilience, courage & determination of Afghan refugees.
-- In Pakistan, @antonioguterres met with refugees and commended the generosity & solidarity Pakistani people have shown hosting millions of refugees: https://t.co/XkJqIjfTsW https://t.co/rmtWMaSeEb

As the UN prepares to turn 75, we want to hear your views on how to tackle the biggest challenges of our time. 

Take the #UN75 survey here: https://t.co/xZylMfLi8z https://t.co/mIpfI7KUGc

For centuries, women have made significant contributions to the world of science. 

@UN_Women shares the stories of 7 trailblazing #WomenInScience. https://t.co/GPtufakdp3

The UN:  
➡️ provides food & aid to 90 million people 🍞
➡️ supplies vaccines to 45% of the world's children 🔬
➡️ provides safe drinking water to 43 million kids 💧 

@UNOCHA explains #WhatItTakes to help some of the world's most vulnerable people. https://t.co/Xywh9AVdz5 https://t.co/I0E7e0Gac7

The world's most vulnerable are often disproportionately impacted when crises hit. 

Flexible social protection programmes that can be rapidly scaled up during emergencies are key to building resilience. https://t.co/x9TQavvzb1 via @WorldBank
See how the UN is supporting #SilencingTheGuns - the @AfricanUnionUN initiative to end all wars, conflict & gender-based violence on the continent. https://t.co/QdQsA0ZL7u https://t.co/Jhc8Pl1ujJ

The world's biodiversity is in jeopardy. 

This upcoming #WorldWildlifeDay, let's commit to creating a world that can sustain all life on Earth. https://t.co/LuyV8dFaal #WWD2020 https://t.co/QQty9ZMqmx

Artisanal gold miners face grave dangers, often working in hazardous conditions without adequate protective equipment. 

@UNmigration is working to raise awareness of the plight of miners in West Africa. https://t.co/yCYdsYk3VV https://t.co/7sU2DprV7W

Friday, 21 February is @VisitUN Kids Day at UNHQ in NYC, a great chance for young visitors to explore the work of the UN through games & other fun activities. https://t.co/OesKd5CN1p https://t.co/6eU7NbVBkE

For 40+ years, Afghans have fled violence, war, conflict & natural disasters. 

Neighbouring countries – like Pakistan & Iran — continue to show generosity by providing refuge to millions of them. via @Refugees https://t.co/yh5bA8Xd13

Health is a human right, not a luxury.

@WHO is calling on all countries to provide more resources to primary health care to ensure #HealthForAll: https://t.co/5xF8dQgnbH https://t.co/EjZQm8q9gZ

60% of the world's population will live in cities by 2030. 

We can all take #ClimateAction to make our cities more sustainable:  
Bike 🚴‍♀️
Walk🚶 
Use public transportation🚋 

https://t.co/e91yBEPCXN #GlobalGoals https://t.co/RchOzePoWx

Apply for the 2020 #MandelaPrize by 28 February.

The award will honour two individuals for their service to humanity. Details on the prize given in recognition of Madiba's extraordinary legacy: https://t.co/tkrfWWhCpn https://t.co/Wxn05KVpjY

Migratory species are essential for sustaining life on earth. 

@BonnConvention #CMSCOP13 gets underway Saturday in India, aiming at putting in place new conservation measures for migratory species. https://t.co/LslEznfWbb https://t.co/MIS583VOnk

Clearing landmines helps protect people from the physical & psychological harm caused by explosive hazards. @UNDP explains how mine clearance is also an important step in achieving the #GlobalGoals: https://t.co/fHdiX4o56r

Pine Island Glacier in Antarctica has spawned a big iceberg which quickly broke into pieces. 

On the continent, evidence of the climate crisis is intensifying, amid reports of new record high temperatures, which @WMO is working to verify. https://t.co/42scdIjqVM #ClimateAction https://t.co/pzEotcOmwK
Syria: @WFP has resumed the distribution of vital aid to civilians trapped in Idlib after a 24-hour pause due to heavy bombing. https://t.co/8Taz7R5kwq

Refugees at the Za'atari camp in Jordan are using recycling to keep their environment clean and as a source of income.

More on how @Refugees' cash-based intervention programmes help the most vulnerable. https://t.co/fEp99GEmnH

https://t.co/CmALgKm9ZY
#LoveIsLove: On Friday's #ValentinesDay, join UN @free_equal & support fair treatment of lesbian, gay, bi, trans & intersex people everywhere. https://t.co/Ljui9GqDYQ https://t.co/n4pAiXqvdJ
As the number of measles cases surges worldwide, @UNICEF & partners are carrying out a major vaccination drive to protect up to 45 million children. #VaccinesWork https://t.co/1hyI9SntHR

Millions of girls around the world are married off before their 18th birthday. 

On Thursday's #ValentinesDay, and every day, @unfpa is helping girls around the 🌍 say #IDONT to child marriage. 
https://t.co/zRp9YsUY2G https://t.co/wU5TmOKbtd

"Education is an essential pillar of a better future, for adolescent girls and for all of society."

-- @antonioguterres at the launch of #DriveForFive at UN Headquarters in NYC. https://t.co/rDyyySn8pO

Taking #ClimateAction is as simple as picking up your phone. 📱 

@UNDP's new #Mission1Point5 mobile game lets you choose climate policies to keep global warming below 1.5°C. https://t.co/sZf25wZ6YF https://t.co/2W1EzojGJU

Cities are hubs for
🎨 cultural
⚗️ scientific &
💰 economic development.

The World Urban Forum stressed the critical need for sustainable urban planning to leverage the unique potential of cities. via @UNEP #WUF10
https://t.co/Nl1Px1QpcE
Libya: Security Council demands commitment to lasting ceasefire and expresses concern over increasing involvement of terrorist groups & mercenaries in the country. https://t.co/Gg5q1ZH30I

"As we strive to achieve the #GlobalGoals & tackle the climate crisis, radio has a key role to play as a source of information & inspiration alike."

-- @antonioguterres on #WorldRadioDay. https://t.co/ET1ddjq6dZ https://t.co/vwWzTeTtK3

“Living here requires strength, personal resilience, passion, empathy & an ability to lead in difficult circumstances." 

Watch Claudine's story to see #WhatItTakes to be a humanitarian worker in some of the world's most challenging places. https://t.co/Xywh9AVdz5 via @UNOCHA https://t.co/XjAq9scrJh

Deforestation & the climate emergency have disrupted rain patterns in Malawi, threatening food security.  

More on how a @WFP solar-powered irrigation project is helping to increase climate resilience & improve people's lives. https://t.co/kwGvtxYt6J https://t.co/lKmpDxhgjB

#TBT to 1953, as Audrey Hepburn prepares to record a radio programme for @UNICEF.

On Thursday's #WorldRadioDay, we celebrate radio's ability to broaden horizons, build more harmonious societies, and unite & empower people. https://t.co/EkuaWEFO0f https://t.co/QaszseNBCi

Syria: 700,000 people have fled conflict areas in Idlib & Aleppo since early December.

@Refugees is providing essential relief items, but as new displacement outstrips capacity, more resources & funding are urgently needed. https://t.co/ItsqeWfFB8

On Thursday's #WorldRadioDay, @UNESCO celebrates the ways in which radio promotes diversity, and allows voices to be represented and heard. 

📻 https://t.co/XXRQ3ivTJn https://t.co/YvPYM5QXwW

"It is our fundamental duty as leaders to do everything in our power to protect children, our future, from the chaos & madness of wars that have nothing to do with them." 

-- @antonioguterres tells the Security Council: https://t.co/y8wC6hn8gt https://t.co/dgiD2P8TNM

.@UNICEF helps children released from armed groups build a new future though education, counselling & training. 

More on Wednesday's Int'l Day against Child Soldiers. https://t.co/v0JzkaPsO9 #ChildrenNotSoldiers https://t.co/dR5924aF7w

The risk of premature death from some of the most common noncommunicable diseases is declining.

We all have a role to play to achieve a better world by 2030. https://t.co/7OIyGEWguU https://t.co/MI22oUumzs

Disease caused by #coronavirus officially named Covid-19 by @WHO.

Experts are advising countries on how to prevent spread of the disease, while also working to strengthen lab capacity & train heath workers. https://t.co/sfFB9NKzKt

"This is a time for dialogue, for reconciliation, for reason. "

-- @antonioguterres urges Israeli & Palestinian leaders to work toward advancing a just and lasting peace in the Middle East. His full remarks to the Security Council: https://t.co/TAchvHXUZK https://t.co/KcU87HYQhj

-- @UNReliefChief calls for greater international support amid looming desert locust catastrophe in Horn of Africa. https://t.co/ShxTkoOJFW

Pulses are delicious & good for our health, but they are also great #ClimateAction tools.

Epilepsy affects around 50 million people worldwide. It's a treatable, neurological disease characterized by recurrent seizures, or brief episodes of involuntary movement.

More on Monday's World #EpilepsyDay: https://t.co/CF1CZbxRqA https://t.co/9m9hQ0m6fh

Homelessness is one of the crudest manifestations of poverty, discrimination & inequality.

A new permanent exhibition titled "Technology Museum: Delivering the Message of Peace" at UNHQ in NYC focuses on connecting the past, present & future of technological progression at the UN. https://t.co/kNbSOaF9gE https://t.co/oWFwa11RVy

It's #Oscars Sunday!

"I commend Africa’s longstanding moral & political leadership on the climate emergency."

As #BlackHistoryMonth continues, watch this tribute to former UN official & Nobel Laureate Ralph Bunche, an "incurable optimist" who dedicated his life to achieving peace & ending oppression worldwide. https://t.co/8s8MUExb4h

9 out of 10 urban residents breathe polluted air.

The sustainable use of oceans, seas, lakes & rivers - otherwise known as the blue economy - could contribute up to $1.5 trillion dollars to the global economy.

More from @africarenewal on its potential to boost African growth: https://t.co/9Um78F2QZw via https://t.co/k6rDt5jaqj

The UN works for everyone, everywhere by 
🇺🇳 preventing conflict

Basic steps can help protect you & your family from #coronavirus.

- Frequently wash hands using soap & water 🤚
- Cover your mouth & nose when coughing or sneezing 🤧 
- Avoid close contact with those who are ill 😷

@UNICEF has more tips. https://t.co/tD7IPtHvSe

@Refugees urges more countries to show solidarity & offer more resettlement places. https://t.co/DNjqLDdjoZ
